website_summaries.verdict: The SpeakerCraft CS3 is a handsome, excellent-sounding sound bar that's well worth its lofty price.
pros: The SpeakerCraft CS3 has an excellent pedestal-style sound bar design, with a refined look that doesn't call attention to itself
Sound quality is outstanding for a pedestal sound bar, even with two-channel music
Its built-in Bluetooth is also a huge plus, making it easy to wirelessly stream music from many tablets and smartphones
cons: It's expensive, especially when there are solid sound bars available for half the price
There's also no front-panel display, so you don't get any visual feedback when adjusting the volume
And the included remote is cheap-feeling for a pricey product

customer_reviews.title: This unit both looks and sounds good. Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why there are so many complaints about the reliability of this unit. Mine lasted almost 10 full days before it died. This unit both looks and sounds good. Excellent sound quality. The remote is absolutely terrible. I think it's an insult that they would send a crappy remote like this to their customers. With the number of complaints, in the reviews, about reliability SpeakerCraft knows this is a problem unit and yet they continue to sell it without fixing it. This shows total disregard for their customer base. Shame on you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Bob

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Support or Repair Service Available anymore
customer_reviews.text: Speakercraft has discontinued this product, and no longer provides repair service or parts! My CS3 was barely 4 years old, and not used very often, so I was extremely unhappy to find out that Speakercraft cannot fix the product anymore. It will not power up. Do NOT buy this product (even though it sounded great when it worked), nor should you buy anything ever from its parent company, Nortek Security & Control!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bob

customer_reviews.title: Two Defective Units In One Year, Not Risking a Third
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned two of these units in a little over a year and I will not be owning a 3rd. Both units experienced the same type of failure: out of the blue, with no sign of distress, the output from all devices became a loud, high-pitched shrill combined with white noise. The manufacturer was of little help with the first unit, but fortunately the vendor, HI-DEF Lifestyle sent a replacement unit even when the warranty had lapsed. When the unit was working, the sound was very good, setup was easy and it looked great, unfortunately both units have broken and I can not see myself purchasing another SpeakerCraft product.
customer_reviews.author: RFG

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound until it dies.
customer_reviews.text: Great Robust Sound. Easy to use with iPhone/iPad to play music over bluetooth. Died on me after less than a year. I mailed it back at my own expense since it was still under warranty and it was replaced. The new one, which I've also had less than a year from when my first was replaced is cutting off for no apparent reason and sounds like it's about to die. This had pretty light use. It has good sound but AWFUL reliability. When this one dies I will not be buying from SpeakerCraft.
customer_reviews.author: Rottimer

customer_reviews.title: no way to replace the remote
customer_reviews.text: The unit is great, but the remote doesn't work and it is impossible to turn on without it. Now, it's impossible to fine a replacement remote.
customer_reviews.author: strgy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome speaker system, poor remote
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best speaker system of it's type. Fantastic sound, Single unit, & relatively small size solved my unusual space problem. The resulting sound far exceeds the Bose pedestal speakers, and most similarly priced sound bars. The remote is terrible, and the indicator light on the front panel is barely visible, but Oh! the sound! Speakercraft was somewhat difficult to contact, but Dave at "Wide World Stereo" answered all my questions and provided wonderful service.
customer_reviews.author: Thump

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Worked or about 14 months, then stopped working properly : the sound kept cutting off. Switched from the optical input to the co-ax, made no difference. Considering the price, I expected a lot more from this unit. The remote is dreadful - just a cheap piece of plastic with limited functionality. No on-screen display, so programming the unit is pretty much hit or miss. On the plus side, when it did work, the sound was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound. Terrible Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. But.... Mine lasted for about year of light use. Started crackling loudly after a few minutes, every time we turned it on. Finally blew up with an explosive pop. Done. Bought online, so no warranty. And it looks like I'm not alone. Any product that gets a 1 rating from about 20% of buyers has a problem. Conclusion: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Unit Died
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted. The sound was very good. Like many other posters here are reporting, the unit died after a period of time (2.5 years). Eerily close to the manufacturer warranty. I probably will not purchase from this brand again unless a longer warranty is provided.
customer_reviews.author: Fern C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This was a great product in terms of the sound
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product in terms of the sound, however, it broke after using for a few months. Don't trust this brand.

customer_reviews.title: SpeakerCraft CS3 Center Stage 80-Watt Bluetooth Ready Sound Base Speaker...
customer_reviews.text: This was for my husband and he loves it! He has moved it around to the various TVs to determine where best to keep it - excellent sound and utility!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose Solo
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bose Solo for several months prior to getting the CS3 and was very disappointed with it's sound. The Bose unit was barely better than the speakers built-in my 40" LCD tv. The CS3, on the other hand, was a dramatic improvement with much fuller bass and wider dynamic range. Yes the remote is cheesy, but it does the job. Superior sound quality is why you buy a Speakercraft CS3, not it's accessories.
customer_reviews.author: G. Card

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: pricy yes but sound is awesome and finally my harmony one remote operates all my stuff! We like that the tv sits on it and it's not on the tv or in front.
customer_reviews.author: rainmom

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Audio and Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Only downside is only 80 watts, but audio quality is very good. System is good looking but the connections to the device are limited. Buy additional optical wire because one shipped with product is only three feet long.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for music, movies and gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase the sound-bar for the price but the space that I have did not accommodate a full 5.1 surround sound system so I pulled the trigger. Along with great sounds the Bluetooth feature is really nice. I use it all the time to play my music from my phone and ipad. The only thing that bugs me is the cheap remote which is the only way to control the audio. A Logitech / Harmony universal remote will solve this thou if you have one. While that being said, the CS3 is a perfect companion for great sounds. It's really is a great sounding unit! 5 stars for awesome sounds!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Garcia

customer_reviews.title: sound is very good. looks very good under my tv
customer_reviews.text: pros. sound is very good . cons. remote is small and gets lost easily.their are no visible indicators when adjusting this unit.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, fantastic sound, and nice looking. Replaced the remote with a Harmony remote to control my tv, speaker, blue ray and roku device. Exactly what I was looking for from SpeakerCraft and the sound is fanastic. All the clutter from my old 7.1 sound system is gone. Cannot understand all the comment about not having a better graphic for volumne control. I listen to this with my ears, not my eyes.

customer_reviews.text: Sounded good until it died!!! I guess 4 mos. is all u get out of these

Unfortunately, this is exactly what happened. Yes, it sounded wonderful while it worked. The customer service/replacement prospects are uneconomical. This unit will go to the dump as I cut my losses. Heartbroken.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: As reviews discuss, remote is pretty crappy but it sounds great! Client really likes it and it was easy to install.

customer_reviews.text: Makes TV sound so alive and real. Easy to hook up. Remote is a bit tiny. Overall, very happy with my new sound.

customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price. Kind of big and heavy, but that's what brings the base!

customer_reviews.title: Incredable sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought the system to get some elevation to my TV, since its stand was too low, and maybe get better sound then what was coming out of the TV. I plugged in my TV via optical, put on a movie and WOW!! Made the room into a theater. Nice unit in looks and ease of operation. However the remote is small and chintzy, and easy to lose. I would give it a perfect 10 with a better remote it would go to 11.

customer_reviews.title: Sound base Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but not really surround sound. Difficult to see if light is on or off. We like it well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and useless
customer_reviews.text: A big Chinese piece of furniture that distorts like hell. Complete waste of money. That's why you get 50% off.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Ambah

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound for a short time... before it died
customer_reviews.text: my soundbar sounds as though it lasted it longer than the others who have left reviews on here, mine lasted a whole 2 years. The sound was great for the 2 years we had it. Remote sucked but other than that no complaints. That is until we went on a weekend trip to come back and find out our soundbar now only makes crackling and popping sounds. Something on the inside burnt out (capacitor/amplifier) who knows. We live in a San Francisco apartment, we never turned the thing up, never taxed the speakers. It’s hooked up to a surge protector also. This thing died for absolutely no reason, it is a real piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Sound Great, Remote Not
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60" Sharp TV sitting on top of my SpeakerCraft CS3 in the corner of my living room. The sound quality is superb, clear and crisp. I could never go back to the TV's built-in speaker. The remote control worked for about a week before it broke. They sent me a replacement. The reviews I read before purchase were spot on - The sound quality is great, the remote is crappy, and there are no displays to know input levels like bass and treble. Switching to Bluetooth and back to the TV is easy. I wish the drawbacks (no display, poor remote) weren't there but am delighted with the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Proud

customer_reviews.title: Speaker "Witch-Craft"
customer_reviews.text: I installed this unit with our game room TV (the room the kids use for movie nights) and the movie sound is incredible. We added another to our other "TV room". It came with an optical audio converter box (which was good since our cable provider's DVR box has analog audio connectors). I agree with others on the remote being sub-optimal; it does not light, so it is impossible to find the right buttons when watching a movie to adjust the volume. But once you crank it up as needed, the theatrical surround sound is "magical"!...ps: I am not an audio-aficionado, this unit was very easy to set up and play.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: SpeakerCraft here, Proficient on Another Site
customer_reviews.text: So which one is it? Other companies that I have purchased from in the past used this same name switching. The product usually isn't that good and there is poor product support if it's there at all. I almost bought this but after doing some research it seems a little risky to buy it. Also the Proficient web site gives no indication at all that this item is also under a SpeakerCraft label.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveTheUSA

Promised would never happen again, they shipped me another one. Tonight the second after only 4 months same loud pop and its done. So do I pay another 150 bucks to ship to get another? Yes at first you will love it but check bestbuy.com and other websites that sale this and read the reviews. Several with same issue. Loud pop and then no sound. I was a little worried that I would not feel like the $600 was worth it, but I quickly knew it was a great investment. It simply sounds great and looks clean and cool. My viewing experience just became much more rich.

customer_reviews.text: Amazingly, SpeakerCraft's own web site won't allow an ordinary user to access brochures and spec sheets for this product. To see that material, you've got to register and log on, but in order to register you need a dealer ID. Consequently, I'm losing interest in this product.
